com.driver

Class Sorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.driver.Sorter

  • public class Sorter
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by FPT on 11/11/2016. Description: Class to take the argument as input from user and use that input to find the data file, as well as to determine the sort type and compare type of the shapes that are taking in from the data file.

      private char compareType 
      private java.io.FileReader dataFile 
      private char sortType

      private java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> getShapeList()
      Support method to go the the data file and get the list of Polygon objects
      private void setCompareType(java.lang.String args)
      Private method to set the compare type taken from the user-provided argument for the Polygon objects

      Private method to get the file name from the argument and open a new FileReader to that data file

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws InvalidArgumentException
        Method to start reading data from the data file and sort it in descending order
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if the arguments taking in from user are not three arguments with one -f for the data file path, -t for the compare type and -s for the sorting type

      • sort

        private java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> sort(java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> sortingList)
                                   throws InvalidSortTypeException
        Private method that sort the list of Polygon objects based on the sort type taken in from user input
        Parameters:
        sortingList - the list of Polygons that need to be sorted
        Returns:
        the sorted list of Polygons from greatest to smallest
        Throws:
        InvalidSortTypeException - is thrown when the sort type is not in the follwing list: 'b' - Bubble Sort 's' - Selection Sort 'i' - Insertion Sort 'm' - Merge Sort 'q' - Quick Sort 'z' - Shell Sort

      • getShapeList

        private java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> getShapeList()
        Support method to go the the data file and get the list of Polygon objects
        Returns:
        the list of Polygon objects from the data file

      • setFile

        private void setFile(java.lang.String args)
        Private method to get the file name from the argument and open a new FileReader to that data file
        Parameters:
        args - the argument taken from user input that starts with -f

      • setCompareType

        private void setCompareType(java.lang.String args)
        Private method to set the compare type taken from the user-provided argument for the Polygon objects
        Parameters:
        args - argument taken from the user input that starts with -t

      • setSortType

        private void setSortType(java.lang.String args)
        Private support method to set the sort type taken from the user-provided argument for this Sorter object
        Parameters:
        args - argument taken from user input that starts with -s
